<controversial>

I'm still not convinced of the economics of unit testing a=
t the 
lowest level.
I've been lurking this list for quite some time, atten=
ded online and 
offline seminars, listened to to Agile, XP and TDD talks, .=
..

And apply it at work.

I am convinced that TDD is a right approach.
I s=
ee big value in the agile methods.
But to my feeling unit testing can be do=
ne at the requirements level.

That's why I am thinking about testdriving t=
his approach:

1: Write unit tests only to test the requirements.
2: Write =
the code that implements these requirements, until tests 
pass.
3: Run the =
unit tests together with a code coverage tool
4: delete all executable line=
s of code not covered by the unit test

</controversial>

Regards, Jan
